intro: Chamaecrista palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's ticktrefoil, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in sandy or rocky soils. It has small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, and it is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in desert ecosystems.
